Posts.EditableText:
when i try to open squiffy this message show up

A javascript error occurred in the main process

uncaught exception:
Syntax Error: Unexpected token

I downloaded squiffy again and still not working, somebody knows why?
Posts.HTML:
when i try to open squiffy this message show up

A javascript error occurred in the main process

uncaught exception:
Syntax Error: Unexpected token

I downloaded squiffy again and still not working, somebody knows why?

Posts.EditableText: Maybe an error trying to open the file you were most recently working on? Try renaming it to see if you can load Squiffy again. Also try completely uninstalling before reinstalling.
Posts.HTML: Maybe an error trying to open the file you were most recently working on? Try renaming it to see if you can load Squiffy again. Also try completely uninstalling before reinstalling.

Posts.EditableText: it still doesn't work, I deleted squiffy and downloaded again and this message still show up
Posts.HTML: it still doesn't work, I deleted squiffy and downloaded again and this message still show up

Posts.EditableText: Was Squiffy ever working on your system? Which version of Windows are you using?
Posts.HTML: Was Squiffy ever working on your system? Which version of Windows are you using?

Posts.EditableText: i used squiffy many times before and I have a windowns 7 professional (Service pack 1)
Posts.HTML: i used squiffy many times before and I have a windowns 7 professional (Service pack 1)

Posts.EditableText:
Can you go to:

C:\Users\<your user name>\AppData\Roaming\squiffy-editor

and open up settings.json in Notepad, and paste it here?

Then try deleting settings.json and open up Squiffy again.

Hopefully that should make Squiffy load - and if you let me know what was in settings.json I can try and fix this to prevent it happening again. (Assuming that deleting settings.json actually fixes the problem)
Posts.HTML:
Can you go to:

C:\Users\<your user name>\AppData\Roaming\squiffy-editor

and open up settings.json in Notepad, and paste it here?

Then try deleting settings.json and open up Squiffy again.

Hopefully that should make Squiffy load - and if you let me know what was in settings.json I can try and fix this to prevent it happening again. (Assuming that deleting settings.json actually fixes the problem)

Posts.EditableText: By the way, the quickest way to get to that folder is to open up Explorer and type "%appdata%" in the address bar.
Posts.HTML: By the way, the quickest way to get to that folder is to open up Explorer and type "%appdata%" in the address bar.

Posts.EditableText: I opened the settings.json and there was nothing there so i deleted it and now squiffy is working fine, thanks
Posts.HTML: I opened the settings.json and there was nothing there so i deleted it and now squiffy is working fine, thanks
